question: 1. (401) How many conductors must a clamp-on ammeter encircle to obtain an accurate current reading?
2. (402) Which measurement determines the length of a screwdriver?
3. (402) When using an adjustable wrench, why do you not apply a pulling force to the adjustable jaw?
options: a. The wrench is likely to slip.
b. You could break your wrist.
c. The wrench is likely to bend.
d. You could break your fingers.
correct: a. The wrench is likely to slip.

question: 4. (403) What tool should you use to cut openings when installing devices in finished walls?
5. (403) How is a hacksaw blade installed?
options: b. Teeth facing away from handle.
c. Teeth facing towards the handle.
d. Depends on material that is being cut.
correct: b. Teeth facing away from handle.

question: 6. (404) What conduit bender is normally used for ½" and ¾" EMT?
7. (405) How do you know when a bit is properly tightened in a cordless drill?
options: a. Use a wrench to tighten the chuck.
b. You tighten it ½ turn past snug.
c. You will hear a clicking sound.
correct: c. You will hear a clicking sound.

question: 8. (406) What is the largest American standard wire gauge (AWG) size electrical wire?

11. (408) What is the purpose of a raised box cover?
options: a. Provides space for three additional devices.
b. Allows for installation of a thicker wall surface after the box is mounted.
c. Allows the box to be mounted five eighths of an inch behind the wall surface. d. Provides added interior space as well as a cover for the box.
d. Provides added interior space as well as a cover for the box.
correct: d. Provides added interior space as well as a cover for the box.

question: 12. (409) When you are connecting rigid conduit to boxes, what is/are required for circuits above 250 volts?
options: a. One locknut and a bushing.
b. Two locknuts and a bushing.
c. Two bushings and a locknut.
d. Two bushings and two locknuts.
correct: b. Two locknuts and a bushing.

question: 13. (409) Which condition below is not allowed?
options: a. Using flexible metal tubing in lengths less than 6 feet.
b. Using flexible metal tubing in lengths greater than 6 feet.
c. Using rigid metal conduit in lengths greater than 6 feet.
d. Using liquid-tight flexible metal conduit in lengths greater than 6 feet.
correct: b. Using flexible metal tubing in lengths greater than 6 feet.

question: 14. (410) Which ratings are always found on switches?
15. (411) What does the label TR signify on duplex receptacles?

18. (414) The normal color code for wiring a device is
options: a. white to gold terminal, black to silver.
b. black to gold terminal, red to silver.
c. black to gold terminal, white to silver.
d. red to gold terminal, black to silver.
correct: c. black to gold terminal, white to silver.

question: 24. (418) To determine the total calculated load of a sub-panel, you should add all the amperages of the branch circuits plus what percent of the amperage of the largest motor?
25. (419) How many current carrying conductors can be installed in raceway before the current capacity of the conductors must be de-rated?
26. (419) All of the following are important when paralleling conductors, except what?
options: a. All conductors must be the same color.
b. Phases and neutrals must be separated.
c. Each neutral is run with its corresponding phases.
d. All conductors must be of same material, size and length.
correct: b. Phases and neutrals must be separated.

question: 27. (420) How many conductors are required for a 3-phase-wye service entrance used for power and lighting?
options: c. Three ungrounded and one grounded neutral conductors.
d. Two ungrounded and one grounded neutral conductors.
correct: c. Three ungrounded and one grounded neutral conductors.

question: 37. (427) Which one of these circuits requires the use of GFCI protection?
options: a. 120 V/20 A receptacles in bathrooms.
b. 120 V/20 A receptacles in bedrooms.
c. 240 V/50 A range circuit. d. 240 V/30 A dryer circuit.
correct: a. 120 V/20 A receptacles in bathrooms.

question: 38. (428) The conductors between the final overcurrent devices and the outlets for connecting electrical equipment are called

43. (433) How is the minimum bend radius of metal clad cable calculated?
options: a. Multiply the radius of the cable by 5.
b. Multiply the cables outside diameter by 5.
c. Multiply the cables outside diameter by 7.
d. Multiply the radius of the cable by 7.
correct: c. Multiply the cables outside diameter by 7.

options: c. smallest conduit on top. d. conduit all at the same time.
d. conduit all at the same time.
correct: d. conduit all at the same time.

question: 50. (439) Electrical metallic tubing (EMT) and IMC require supports within how many inches and feet of each outlet box, junction box, cabinet, or fitting, and every other foot thereafter.
51. (440) The number of conductors you can put in conduit is based on the
options: a. size of conduit, conductor insulation, and length of run.
b. size of conduit, conductor size, and conductor insulation.
c. size of conductor, length of run, and number of bends.
d. conductor insulation , length of run, and number of bends.
correct: b. size of conduit, conductor size, and conductor insulation.

55. (444) The magnetic field of a three-phase motor rotor is caused by a. resistance in the squirrel cage. b. current flow in the rotor.
options: a. resistance in the squirrel cage.
b. current flow in the rotor.
d. voltage in the end bells.
correct: b. current flow in the rotor.

question: 56. (445) Which of the following features describes three-phase motors best?
options: a. Either single- or dual-voltage motors.
b. Must be supplied by 220 volts.
correct: a. Either single- or dual-voltage motors.

options: a. Converter, alternating current (AC) Bus, and Inverter.
b. Converter, direct current (DC) Bus, and Inverter.
c. Pulse width modulation (PWM) Converter, DC Bus, and Inverter.
correct: b. Converter, direct current (DC) Bus, and Inverter.
